description: On March 17, 2020, the Bolivian Government declares a quarantine that obliges all residents and people residing in Boliva to stay in their homes between 5pm and 5am.

On March 21, 20202, the Bolivian Government declares a curfew in the national territory, called Total Quarantine, from March 22 to April 4 which suspends all private and public activities and allows only one person of each family to leave the house once a day between 7:00am and 12:00 noon.
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: On March 21, 20202, the Bolivian Government declares a curfew in the national territory, called Total Quarantine, from March 22 to April 4 which suspends all private and public activities and allows only one person of each family to leave the house once a day between 7:00am and 12:00 noon. On March 25, 2020, the Bolivian Government prolongs the lockdown from March 26 to April 15 and reduces the leave hours to 8:00am until 12:00 noon. Furthermore, only persons between 18 and 65 years are allowed to leave the house according to the end number of their ID which is assigned to one weekday between Monday to Friday.
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: On March 21, 20202, the Bolivian Government declares in decree 4199 a total quarantine in the national territory from March 22 to April 4 which suspends all private and public activities and allows only one person of each family to leave the house once a day between 7:00am and 12:00 noon. On March 25, 2020, the Bolivian Government prolongs the lockdown from March 26 to April 15 and reduces the leave hours to 8:00am until 12:00 noon.
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description:
On March 21, 20202, the Bolivian Government declares in decree 4199 a total quarantine in the national territory from March 22 to April 4 which suspends all private and public activities and allows only one person of each family to leave the house once a day between 7:00am and 12:00 noon. 
On March 25, this lockdown is prolonged until April 15 and leaving the house has been restricted to 8:00am until 12:00 noon. Only people between 18 and 65 years are allowed to leave the house according to the end numbers of the ID on weekdays Monday to Friday. 
On April 14, 2020, the Bolivian Government extends the lockdown to April 30 in the context of the extended total quarantine.
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: On April 1st, Bolivia issues nation-wide curfew as a measure of prevention and containment of the virus.

On April 29, 20202, the Bolivian Government installs a conditional and dynamic quarantine in the context of the national sanitarian emergency with different levels of measures corresponding to the current risk due to the coronavirus. The quarantine level define different curfew hours for specific age groups of people.
All measures linked to the quarantine stay in place.

On April 29, 20202, the Bolivian Government installs a conditional and dynamic quarantine in the context of the national sanitarian emergency with different levels of measures corresponding to the current risk due to the coronavirus. The quarantine level define different curfew hours for specific age groups of people.
All measures linked to the quarantine stay in place.
On May 28, this policy is extended until June 30.

Administrative staff is exempt from this regulation.

description: On April 1, 2020, Bolivia enacts in law N 1293 5 I that the treatment of COVID-19 shall be granted for free by the public health subsector to the affected population.

description: On April 1, 2020, Bolivia enacts in law 1293  5 II that the health ministry and the autonomous regional authorities shall guarantee the provision of necessary material for health facilities of the public subsector and shall realise the treatment of corona virus infections.

description: On April 14, 2020, the Bolivian Government announces that the Ministry of Health and the Short-Term Social Security entities are exceptionally authorized to directly contract an annual collective insurance for total and permanent disability or death for a period of one year, for health professionals and workers affected by the care or provision of services related to patients infected by the Coronavirus (COVID-19), who work in health establishments, clinics and others of the Public, Short-Term Social Security and Private Subsectors of the National Health System.

description: On March 21, 2020, the Bolivian Government enacts in decree 4199 that public and private companies and people dedicated to the elaboration of products of hygiene and medicines, will have to continue their activities uninterruptedly or according to the modality applicable to their activity despite the declared total quarantine in the same decree, in order to guarantee the productive and supply chain. On March 25, this policy was prolonged by decree 4200 from March 26 to April 15. On April 14, 20202, the policy was prolonged to April 30.

On April 14, the policy is announced to be extended again to April 30 in the context of the declared total quarantine

On March 21, 2020 the Bolivian Government enacts that the health services of the public and private sectors must provide their maximum collaboration without interruption in the care against the contagion and propagation of the Coronavirus (COVID-19) in accordance with Article 38, paragraph II of the Political Constitution of the State. On March 25, this policy was prolonged to April 15, 2020. On April 14, 2020, this policy was again extended in the context of the strengthening of the total quarantine to April 30.

description: On April 16, 2020, the Bolivian Government reduces temporarily to zero (0%) percent the tariff charge until December 31 of this administration for the import of inputs, medicines, medical devices, equipment, reagents and fever detectors, acquired or donated, related to the coronavirus that in Annex is an indivisible part of this Supreme Decree. On April 28, this policy is replaced by another policy.

description: On April 20, 2020, Bolivia enacts in decree No 4223 1 that in the context of law N 1293 and in acknowledging the fundamental rights of life and health the Foreign Ministry is authorised to realise public-private transfers destined for purchasing of cleaning, hygienic and sanitarian products and others for Bolivian citizens abroad in situations of vulnerability and/or emergency during the sanitarian emergency of the corona virus.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On April 28, 2020, the Bolivan Government enacts that personnel with respiratory symptoms or personnel from a risk group working in institutions and companies in the health sector, burial services and cementries shall not realise procedure related to the handling of bodies with confirmed or suspected cases of the coronavirus (COVID-19).

On April 28, 2020, the Bolivian Government enacts a policy influencing the health resources by reducing the tariff charge to zero (0%) percent for the import of inputs, medicines, medical devices and equipment which are acquired or donated for the care of Coronavirus (COVID-19), type I and II diabetes, renal diseases, cardiovascular diseases, neurological diseases and oncological diseases.
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On April 28, 2020, the Bolivan Government enacts that institutions and companies in the health sector, burial services and cementries have to offer their personnel biosecure equipment for the treatment of bodies of deceased who died due to the coronavirus (COVID-19).

On April 29, 2020, the Bolivian Government obliges everyone to wear a mask, to permanently hand wash and to comply with the protocols of hygiene and biosecurity within the framework of Conditional and Dynamic Quarantine until May 31, 2020.

On April 28, 2020, the Bolivian Government establishes a procedure in the case of a decease by the coronavirus (COVID-19). This includes the information about the death, the bury of the body, the cremation or bury of the body, the possible transportation distance, the assistent of the burial/cremation by family members and the participation in the vigil by the body.
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Municipal Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On April 28, 2020, the Bolivian Government prohibits every practice of tanatosthesia, interventions of tanatopraxis of neither religious and/or cultural intentions which imply invasive proceedings in the body or manipulation or unnecessary handling of the deceased due to the coronavirus (COVID-19); every type of wake of the body in the coffin in public or private installations or in the residents of the deceased; the burial of the deceased in mass graves unless the number of deceased du to the epidemic surpases the capacity of the cementries; the conservation of bodies of the deceased in cold environments (cabinets, mortuary or cold storage) unless the capacity for cremation is not exceeded.
Bolivia suspends all travels, including air, overland or sea journey, for travelers between departments (states) and traveler between provinces from March 21.
target_geog_level: A geographical or administrative unit within a country
target_province: Pando; Beni; La Paz; Oruro; Cochabamba; Santa Cruz; Potos; Chuquisaca; Tarija
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: Bolivia suspends all travels, including air, overland or sea journey, for travelers between departments (states) and traveler between provinces from March 21. On April 29, the government enacts within the framework of Conditional and Dynamic Quarantine that all international flights remain suspended until May 31, 2020.
target_geog_level: A geographical or administrative unit within a country
target_province: Pando; Beni; La Paz; Oruro; Cochabamba; Santa Cruz; Potos; Chuquisaca; Tarija
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: On March 21, 2020, the Bolivian Government enacts an internatal border restriction by prohibiting the circulation of motorised vehicles, whether private or public, without an authorisation by the corresponding authorities.
target_geog_level: A geographical or administrative unit within a country
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: On March 21, 2020, the Bolivian Government enacts an internatal border restriction by prohibiting the circulation of motorised vehicles, whether private or public, without an authorisation by the corresponding authorities. On March 25, 2020, this restriction was prolonged from March 26 to April 15.
target_geog_level: A geographical or administrative unit within a country
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: On March 21, 2020, the Bolivian Government enacts an internatal border restriction by prohibiting the circulation of motorised vehicles, whether private or public, without an authorisation by the corresponding authorities. On March 25, 2020, this restriction was prolonged from March 26 to April 15. On April 14, this policy was extended again until April 30.
target_geog_level: A geographical or administrative unit within a country
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: On March 21, 20202, the Bolivian Government declares in decree 4199 a total quarantine in the national territory from March 22 to April 4 which suspends all private and public activities and allows only one person of each family to leave the house once a day between 7:00am and 12:00 noon. On March 25, 2020, the Bolivian Government prolongs the lockdown from March 26 to April 15 and reduces the leave hours to 8:00am until 12:00 noon.
type_sub_cat: Lockdown only applies to people of certain ages (Please note the age restriction in the text box)
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: On March 21, 20202, the Bolivian Government declares in decree 4199 a total quarantine in the national territory from March 22 to April 4 which suspends all private and public activities and allows only one person of each family to leave the house once a day between 7:00am and 12:00 noon. On March 25, 2020, the Bolivian Government prolongs the lockdown from March 26 to April 15 and reduces the leave hours to 8:00am until 12:00 noon. Furthermore, only persons between 18 and 65 years are allowed to leave the house according to the end number of their ID which is assigned to one weekday between Monday to Friday.
type_sub_cat: Lockdown only applies to people of certain ages (Please note the age restriction in the text box)
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: On March 25, 2020, the Bolivian Government announces that within the framework of the national health emergency and total quarantine and in accordance with the constitution, the central level of the State has the competence to elaborate the national health policy and the national norms that regulate the operation of all the sectors, areas and practices related to health. The central level of the State is also the governing body of the health system.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
type_sub_cat: New Task Force or Bureau (i.e. establishment of a temporary body)
compliance: Mandatory (Other; please list other enforcement mechanisms in the text entry)

description: On March 25, 2020, the Bolivian Government assigns the function of acquiring medicines, medical deviced, inputs, reactives and medical equipment as well as the function of contracting consulting services of health personal to the Centre for Health Supplies (Central de Abstecimiento y Suministros de Salud CEASS) for the period of the implementation of actions and measures against the coronavirus (COVID-19).
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
type_sub_cat: New Task Force or Bureau (i.e. establishment of a temporary body)
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On March 25, 2020, the Bolivian Government enacts that within the framework of the national health emergency and total quarantine, the Autonomous Territorial Entities, within the framework of their competencies, must exercise the steering role in health issues in their jurisdictions in accordance with the guidelines and policies issued by the central level of the State. In the event that the Autonomous Territorial Entities do not comply, the Departmental Health Services (SEDES) shall exceptionally and temporarily be transferred to the Ministry of Health as a technical, administrative and management unit. The Ministry of Economy and Public Finance is authorized to make the corresponding budgetary modifications.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
type_sub_cat: New Task Force or Bureau (i.e. establishment of a temporary body)
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On March 25, 2020, the Bolivian Government enacts that within the framework of the national health emergency and total quarantine, the Autonomous Territorial Entities, within the framework of their competencies, must exercise the steering role in health issues in their jurisdictions in accordance with the guidelines and policies issued by the central level of the State. In the event that the Autonomous Territorial Entities do not comply, the Departmental Health Services (SEDES) shall exceptionally and temporarily be transferred to the Ministry of Health as a technical, administrative and management unit. The Ministry of Economy and Public Finance is authorized to make the corresponding budgetary modifications. On April 14 the policy has been extended until April 30.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
type_sub_cat: New Task Force or Bureau (i.e. establishment of a temporary body)
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On May 28, 2020, the Bolivian Government authorises the highest executive authorities of the Departments of Beni and Santa Cruz to make budgetary modifications within its institutional budget for the prevention, containment and treatment of Coronavirus infection in the context of rising case numbers in these departments.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
type_sub_cat: New Task Force or Bureau (i.e. establishment of a temporary body)
target_geog_level: A geographical or administrative unit within a country

description: On May 28, 2020, the Bolivian Government authorises the highest executive authorities of the municipalities of La Santsima Trinidad y Montero to make budgetary modifications within its institutional budget for the prevention, containment and treatment of Coronavirus infection in the context of rising case numbers in these municipalities.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
type_sub_cat: New Task Force or Bureau (i.e. establishment of a temporary body)
target_geog_level: A geographical or administrative unit within a country

description: On March 27, Bolivia anounced a reduction of 30 percent of the monthly electricity payments for all private consumers for the month April.
type_text: Reduction of the monthly electricity payments for private consumers
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On March 27, Bolivia anounced a special payment of 500 bolivianos (67 euros) to vulnerable families to cover additional expenses for health, transport and nutrition caused by the curfew and the sanitary emergency.
type_text: Economic measure to support low income families
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description: On April 2, Bolivia enacted a payment reduction of 50% for basic services (water, gas and electricity) during the sanitary emergency, conceding a period of three months after the end of the sanitary emergency to readapt the payments to regular standards.
type_text: Reduction of payments for basic services (wtaer, gas, electricity) of 50 %
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description: On April 3, Bolivia authorized financing institutions to automatically defer  instalments corresponding to the payment of credit repayments (capital and interest) for the months of March, April and May. The deferment may not imply elevated costs for the borrower.
type_text: authorization and regulation of credit deferrals
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On April 3, Bolivia obliged all financing institutions to priorize the attendance of income, invalidity payments and retirement benefits as well as payments of financial benefits related to the Coronavirus. The affected institutions will be compensated equally to the institutions with signed contracts for these services. The duration is vinculated to the sanitary emergency.
type_text: Prioritisation of payments for beneficiary groups (invalids, beneficiaries of the coronavirus payments)

description: On March 11, the Ministry of Health anounced public awareness campaigns, i.e. the provision of up-dates on the spreading of COVID-19 to the citizens via various communicational channels.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On April 1st, Bolivia declares activities, actions and measures for the prevention, containment and treatment of COVID 19 of national interest and priority
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On April 1st, Bolivian State declares a national interest and priority all activities and measures for the prevention, containment and treatment of COVID-19
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: From April 1st, as an exception, the Bolivian media of communication has to disseminate educational and informative campaigns in a mandatory fashion and free of charge for the prevention and containment of COVID-19.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate
enforcer: National Government,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On March 13th, the Bolivian government in its decree 1490 mandates passengers flying in from countries with previous epidemiological history of COVID-19 cases to submit themselves into a 14-day home isolation and to contact the health authority if symptoms of respiratory infection present themselves
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On March 16th, Bolivian government prohibits all activities and events in discotheques, bars, cinemas, sports venues, gyms and amusement parks.
enforcer: National Government,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On March 21, 2020, the Bolivian Government regulates businesses by installing a schedule from 6:00am to 1:00pm for staff from supermarkets, corner shops, supply centers of essential goods from March 22 to April 5.
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: On March 21, 2020, the Bolivian Government enacts that private or public companies dedicated to the supply of articles of primery necessity must carry out their activities without interruption or according to the modality applicable to their activity, shall carry out their activities from Monday to Saturday, 24 hours a day and must provide the means of transport and the corresponding authorisations for the movement of their personnel.
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: On March 25, 2020, the Bolivian Government regulates businesses by installing a movement schedule from 6:00am to 1:00pm for staff from supermarkets, corner shops, supply centers of essential goods and it allows only the minimum number of persons for maintaining the operation of the shop to work.

On March 25, 2020, the Bolivian Government enacts a restriction of businesses by estabilishing an opening schedule from 8:00 am to 12:00 noon for banks, financial entities which are no banks, corner shops, shops, supermarkets and centers of essential goods.
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: On March 21, 2020, the Bolivian Government enacts a restriction of businesses by deciding that private or public companies dedicated to the supply of articles of primery necessity must carry out their activities without interruption or according to the modality applicable to their activity, shall carry out their activities from Monday to Saturday, 24 hours a day and must provide the means of transport and the corresponding authorisations for the movement of their personnel. On March 25, 2020, this restriction was prolonged from March 26 to April 15.
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: On March 21, 2020, the Bolivian Government regulates businesses by installing a schedule from 6:00am to 1:00pm for staff from supermarkets, corner shops, supply centers of essential goods from March 22 to April 5. On March 25, this policy is replaced by another policy that additionally minimises the number of persons working in theses establishments.
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: On March 21, 2020, the Bolivian Government enacts that private or public companies dedicated to the supply of articles of primery necessity must carry out their activities without interruption or according to the modality applicable to their activity, shall carry out their activities from Monday to Saturday, 24 hours a day and must provide the means of transport and the corresponding authorisations for the movement of their personnel. On March 25, 2020, this restriction was prolonged from March 26 to April 15. On April 14, this policy was extended until April 30.
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: On March 25, 2020, the Bolivian Government enacts a restriction of businesses by estabilishing an opening schedule from 8:00 am to 12:00 noon for banks, financial entities which are no banks, corner shops, shops, supermarkets and centers of essential goods. On April 14, this policy is prolonged to April 30 in the context of the extension of the total quarantine.
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines
